intro: Asplundianthus scabrifolius, commonly known as the roughleaf asplundianthus, is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its distinctive foliage and floral structure. It typically features narrow, serrated leaves that are covered in a rough, textured surface, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often pink or purple in color, adding ornamental value to its appearance. It is native to specific regions in South America and thrives in well-drained soils with moderate sunlight. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
